answerText: John Milton[10] Milton's 1645 collection also included Arcades and this other masque, which concludes after the nymph Sabrina is conjured by the Attending Spirit to liberate Lady from a the titular trickster's chair of sexual deviancy.
heading: Terrapin |2013 | Chris Ray - FINAL | 4 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This author wrote an elegy for those who "kept thy truth so pure of old / When all our fathers worshipped stocks and stones" after Charles Emanuel II's slaughter of Waldensians, his "On the Late Massacre in Piedmont." For 10 points each: [10] Identify this author who wrote that "the Sun himself withheld his wonton speed" in "On the Morning of Christ's Nativity," part of a major 1645 collection that also included "Upon the Circumcision."
